item.title: How the Bushman women show their admiration for the horse
item.summary: The admiration of Bushman women for the horse. The sound of the cantering of horses imitated by them. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-31. 8737-8740). The people say that the horse canters, or dances because it feels proud on account of the women's admiration.
item.comments: 1) See also !kuppen (imitation of the sound of horses), 2) p.8736v: a click used by women to show admiration, 3) p.8737v: |han≠kass'o does not know the song the women sing, as it is a 'woman's song', 4) This story is found in Book VIII-31
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
